title: Eksamen IIKG3020 (2023) — Multiple Choice Questions (45 points)
description: Multiple Choice Questions from the IIKG3020 exam 2023. Use for practice and self-testing.

questions.question: What is DETT&CT?
choices: An update to ATT&CK developed by MITRE
A scoring system for implementation of ATT&CK IDS signatures
The red team version of ATT&CK
A framework assisting blue teams to map their detection coverage to ATT&CK

questions.question: Which of these is not an incident containment step?
choices: Reconfiguring a firewall to block traffic

questions.question: Which if these documents contains the most detailed steps on how to perform incident response?
Who should be on top of the list of who to communicate with in a DDoS incident?
What is the main goal of campaign analysis according to the intrusion kill chain model?
choices: To determine the intruders tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTP)
To prepare for legal action against intruders

questions.question: In the CVD process, who is responsible for preparing a fix for the vulnerability?
choices: Both the reporter and the vendor together

questions.question: Which TLP marking should be used for sharing information that should only be spread on a need-to-know basis within an organization?
Which of these is a definite indicator of an incident?
What is the most efficient way of monitoring files and directories for unexpected changes?
Who would be the main consumers of tactical threat intelligence in the organization?
Which of these is an example of a CSIRT reactive service?
On what time scale would a cyber threat analyst typically perform "Outside-the-box" analytics?
Which of these is not a MITRE ATT&CK Tactic category?
What does "dwell time" refer to?
choices: The average amount of time an attacker spends in the reconnaissance phase before getting initial access to a system
The average amount of time a threat actor spends inside a system before they get detected by incident responders
The average amount of time an loT device is part of a DDoS botnet before it gets cleaned up
The average amount of time it takes for an incident handler to resolve an incident

questions.question: What is the advantage of intrusion reconstruction using the cyber kill chain from the defender's point of view?
choices: It forces an adversary to change every phase of their intrusion in order to achieve their goals in subsequent intrusions
It enables defenders to initiate the incident response to after the exploit phase
It forces the adversary to adjust their actions on objectives
It enables the defenders to move their detection and analysis to the latter phases of the kill chain

questions.question: When should you develop the actual incident response plan in the IR planning process?
choices: After you develop the IR planning policy but before you organise the CSIRT
After you have created the IR strategies and procedures
This should be the first step in the process

questions.question: How can MISP be used in incident response?
choices: For pivoting indicators of compromise during threat hunting
As a sandbox for dynamic malware analysis
For sharing of indicators between CSIRTs to implement better hypotheses for threat hunting
As a tool for reverse engineering

questions.question: Which catalog should you use to find an overview of vulnerabilities known to be exploited by ransomware campaigns?
Why would an anomaly-based IDS be better at detection of zero-day attacks than a signature based IDS?
choices: Anomaly-based detection can start working as soon as the APT weaponizes the vulnerability
Anomaly-based detection can start working from "Day 0"
Anomaly-based detection might detect the exploit as soon as it is being used
Signature-based detection is only effective after a patch has been released

questions.question: What is the most important step in the threat intelligence cycle?
Why has the "dwell time" as reported by Mandiant decreased significantly the last few years?
choices: Increased information sharing among responders has led to more efficient response
Incident responders have become significantly more effective at detecting intrusions
Nation state threat actors have become less stealthy
The amount of incident response to ransomware attacks has increased significantly vs APT-style attacks

questions.question: How can passive DNS be used in incident response?
choices: Implement allow lists based on legitimate user activity
Discover which users clicked on a malicious link
Uncover all domains using the same name server infrastructure used by a “known bad” domain
Track web browsing activity of insider threat actors

questions.question: A newly disclosed vulnerability requires physical access, has high attack complexity, requires escalated privileges and user interaction to be exploited and impacts confidentiality, integrity and availability to a high degree. What would be the most likely CVSS version 3 score?
What is the main advantage of using an intelligence feedback loop in computer network defense?
choices: It helps defenders fixing the flaws that resulted in the compromise by root cause analysis
It increases the adversary’s likelihood of success with each subsequent intrusion attempt
It increases the defender’s likelihood of discovering new vulnerabilities in their own systems with each subsequent intrusion attempt
It enables defenders to establish a state of information superiority

questions.question: What is on top of the pyramid of pain?
choices: The type of indicator that would cause the most pain to an adversary if you as a defender deny that indicator to them
Indicators that are the easiest to respond to

questions.question: In the current cyber threat landscape, which threat actor category has the highest sophistication, resource level and commitment?
In what phase in the intrusion kill chain model is patching a useful course of action?
What is the least complex IPS response technique?
choices: Changing the security environment by automatic reconfigurations
Change the attack’s content by removing or replacing malicious files
Act as a proxy and normalize incoming packets in-line
Stopping the attack itself by terminating network connections or user sessions

questions.question: What kind of response actions would be more challenging to automate with a SOAR?
choices: Gathering context to alerts from users

questions.question: What is an example of an atomic indicator?
What can organisations do to avoid becoming part of the problem and misused as reflectors in DDoS attacks on others?
choices: Monitor DDoS backscatter traffic in darknets
Stress-test own infrastructure to determine bottle-necks
Deploy anti-spoofing on all network edges
Monitor BGP traffic to detect IP hijacking

questions.question: Which CSIRT organizational model is most commonly found in large, distributed organisations such as multinational corporations?
Which one of these claims related to legal frameworks for CSIRT information sharing is true?
choices: GDPR is not applicable to CSIRT information sharing
Processing of personal data such as IP addresses is allowed for the purposes of ensuring network and information security
NIS2 gives a weaker legal provision for CSIRT information sharing than GDPR
GDPR does not allow CSIRTs to share information containing personal data

questions.question: What best describes threat hunting?
choices: Analysis driven by AI using ML to inform defenders

questions.question: Which of these tools is typically used for artifact analysis?
What is the most overlooked critical step when preparing to respond to a ransomware incident?
choices: No way for users to report suspicious emails
Not maintaining a hard copy of contact lists

questions.question: What is on top of the Incident Response Hierarchy of Needs?
Which of these measures do you think would be the least accurate performance indicator for measuring CSIRT effectiveness?
choices: Number of incidents reported per year
Number of hours spent on resolving incidents per team member per year

questions.question: What is usually the purpose of filtering IDS alarms?

The “Heartbleed” bug was a serious vulnerability in the OpenSSL cryptographic software library that was published in 2014. When exploited it led to memory leaks that could contain private key material. At the time of publication, it was not known if this bug had already been exploited in the wild. How could analysts find out if this bug had already been exploited in their networks before patches were available and applied?
choices: Threat hunting activities in historical logs
Setting up block lists to stop exploit attempts
Setting up honeypots to entrap attackers

questions.question: Which of the following incident handling life cycle models involves the most steps?
choices: The NIST incident response life cycle
The CERT/CC incident handling life cycle

questions.question: Which of these is mostly used to detect insider threats?
What is the first and most important step that CERT/CC recommends when starting the process of implementing a CSIRT?
What comes last of these in the Mandiant cyber attack life cycle?
Which of these acronyms represent the most automated type of detection and response tools?
